source: Academic Market Microstructure (Easley et al., NYU Stern)
title: VPIN-Style Order Flow Toxicity
mechanism: VPIN measures the probability of informed trading by tracking order flow imbalance velocity. High toxicity = high probability of informed traders present. In Kalshi, we can compute trade imbalance velocity - if YES trades are accelerating faster than NO trades, informed traders may be loading YES.

proposed_signal.condition: Rolling 10-trade imbalance changes by >50% in a short window
proposed_signal.action: Follow the direction of accelerating imbalance
proposed_signal.expected_edge: +3-6% if flow acceleration indicates informed trading

price_proxy_risk: LOW - measures trade flow velocity, not price levels
novelty_vs_tested: H052 tested order flow imbalance rate-of-change but was REJECTED as price proxy. This uses ACCELERATION (second derivative) not just velocity
